title: Obama: Crooner-in-chief - CNNPolitics.com
text: President Obama talks to Davy Crockett and then sings 01:30 Washington (CNN) President Barack Obama appears to be a good mood after the "best week ever," singing at a speaking engagement on Wednesday. The President serenaded a crowd in Tennessee as he answered questions about Obamacare. The crooner-in-chief was responding to a question posed by a man named Davy Crocket, who inquired about his ability to obtain social security benefits. "Your name's really Davy Crockett?" Obama asked. When the man said 'yes,' Obama asked where his beaver skin hat was, per the American folk tale character. Crockett responded it was at home. Davy Crockett theme Obama then sang a few words of the Davy Crockett theme song before promising to check with the Social Security administrator about the hold-up. JUST WATCHED
